challengeName: IBM Castle - Tablet/Desktop Responsive UI Prototype Challenge
detailedRequirements:
Welcome to IBM Castle - Tablet/Desktop Responsive UI Prototype Challenge. This UI Prototype is part of the IBM Castle Blitz Challenge Series. Make sure to check it out!

The main task of this challenge is to continue prototyping the IBM Castle Responsive Email Application. This is a continuation of the Mobile challenge that just completed. In this challenge, we need your help to update the Mobile views and create the responsive Tablet and Desktop versions.

Important! This is for IBM! Your code must be well documented so we can continue developing in future challenges.

At the of this challenge, we need a solid UI prototype using best coding practice/solutions. Good luck and we’re looking forward to your submissions!

Important: Additional Challenge Rules!
For this UI Prototype challenge, we will be using a Checkpoint and Final Round Format.
- At the Checkpoint, we will award $100 for every submission that meets the Checkpoint requirements.
- We have an in-person meeting on 23/03/16 and would like to review your current progress/address any questions.

Checkpoint Requirements
Submitted Before: 23/03/16 @ 9AM EST
- Updated UI Prototype for DESKTOP VERSION of these following tasks:
01. Landing Screen / Message list
02. Message Detail
03. New Message  
04. Message List Flow

Final Round Requirements
Submitted Before: 27/03/16 @ 9AM EST
- Final Updated UI Prototype for MOBILE, TABLET and DESKTOP VERSION of these following tasks:
00. Mobile Missing Screens
01. Landing Screen / Message list
02. Message Detail
03. New Message  
04. Message List Flow

Important:
- We have 2-3 screens still being refined.
- We will work with you on getting them updated during the challenge or during final fixes (as extra paid tasks)
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
Project Details:
Welcome back to the IBM Castle UI Prototype build! We are excited to keep this project moving along. Make sure ask questions as we are starting to add Tablet and Desktop views and I am sure there are some inconsistencicies that will be found. As part of this process please also recommend your solution if you find inconsistencies. We will have a Checkpoint in this challenge - make sure to submit for feedback. We also have some additional design refinements arriving in the next 24 hours from the designer to help with the inconsistencies - this shouldn't stop you from getting started and any large items will be discussed for Final Fixes. 

Looking forward to your great code! Thank you

Downloadable Files:
Storyboard.zip - Use this storyboard design (note 03-Desktop Fixes folder)
Prototype.zip - Existing Mobile Prototype

Important!
- Great Responsive (commented) code
- The provided UI Prototype is tested and works on mobile screens.
- You must include the Responsive Breakpoints for Mobile, Tablet, Desktop (best practice)
- We will eventually be converting this to Angular - please be mindful of best practices
- AngularJS is the preferred JavaScript framework for any JavaScript items
- The base prototype should be created using Bootstrap 
- For any new interactions must be built using AngularJS.
- Please continue using JSON format to store data.
- Any new graphics need to be added as sprite images
- Follow fonts like storyboard look, you need use Helvetica Neue, with fallback to Helvetica and Arial fonts
- The Challenge winner will be responsible for fixing any issues found during code review (existing or new) after responsive view updates. The important thing is creating a great HTML application!

Responsive Sizes:
a. Desktop Size
- Provided storyboard using Standard (1x) size 1280px width
- Set 1025px min-width for all desktop sizes
- Desktop sizes need to be fluid starting from 1025px and upper

b. Tablet Size
- Provided storyboard using Standard (1x) size
- Tablet Size breakpoints is within 768px and 1024px
- We provided how tablet look on Portrait View
- All pages need to use fluid layout when transform into Landscape or Portrait view.
- Make sure your submission look sharp on Standard and Retina size

c. Mobile Size
- Provided storyboard using iPhone 6 Retina Portrait display (750px).
- Make sure your submission support Standard layout with 320px width  
- Make user graphics look sharp on Retina and Standard version
- All pages need use fluid layout when transform into Landscape or Portrait view.
- You might need to adjust some element placement in 320px width screen size. Let’s discuss any doubt about adjustments

~
UI Prototype Page Requirements
00. Mobile Missing Screen
We have a few screens that we were not able to complete in the mobile design challenge that we must now complete. Create these screens in mobile, tablet, and desktop sizes.

a. Login
DESKTOP VERSION
screenshot: Desktop/D00_Login.jpg
- For Desktop version, IBM logo and title need use left alignment
- Login form on Desktop version need move up and wrapped with box format
- Create error validation message and red colored for the button (screenshot: Desktop/D00_Login1.jpg)
- Need update the IBM logo and title centered like Tablet and Mobile version
- No need “Please Login to Your account” title
- Use proper sizing for all text inputs and buttons
- Desktop version is using Standard Size

TABLET VERSION
screenshot: Tablet/T00_Login.jpg
- For tablet version, IBM logo and title placed centered on background image
- Form login inputs need use fluid width
- Create error validation message and red colored for the button (screenshot: Tablet/T00_Login1.jpg)

MOBILE VERSION
screenshot: Mobile/00_Login.jpg
- Create Login page, this Login page will be default when user open the prototype
- Background image need covered whole browser height, match the height
- IBM logo placed on center
- IBM App title placeholder need use center alignment and need to be editable
- Display Intranet ID and Password as text placeholder
- Remember me placed on left side. User need able to toggle checkbox by click the label
- Forget Password placed on the right side, and can be dead link
- Provide note about required login information
- Create error validation with red colored button and message that shows up on top of login form (screenshot: Mobile/00_Login1.jpg)
- After typed correct Login information, need take user to existing Message List page
- Check the Maintenance Schedule button can be dead link

b. Full Profile
DESKTOP VERSION
- Missing Full Profile screen for desktop look. Use fluid mobile version for now.

TABLET VERSION
screenshot: Tablet/T07_ Profile.jpg
- Use fluid version based on mobile look
- Need place email address below the name, not moving it under Contact Information
- Re-use menu button, ignore back button on storyboard

MOBILE VERSION
screenshot: Mobile/01_Profile.jpg
- User landed on Full Profile page after click “My Profile” menu on Sidebar navigation
- Full Profile area need covered whole browser screen
- Menu button turn into white colored
- Profile area use blue background color
- Profile name and email placed next to user thumbnail
- Edit Profile button can be dead link
- Contact Information list placed as separated rows
- Linked and Facebook links need use correct link format and opened in new tab window

c. Settings
DESKTOP VERSION
- Missing Settings screen on desktop. Use fluid mobile version for now.

TABLET VERSION
- Missing Settings screen on tablet. Use fluid mobile version for now.

MOBILE VERSION
screenshot: Mobile/02_Setting.jpg
- This is Settings screen look on mobile
- Menu button placed on the left side and need open existing sidebar menu
- Done button placed on the right side and can be dead link
- Settings page, need to be divided by these following sections

Account
- Email and Sync mode can be dead links
- Out of Office will take user to separated page. Explained below.

Mail
- All rows can be dead links
- Make sure toggle function works for radio button

Calendar
- All rows can be dead links
- Make sure toggle function works for radio button

Contacts
- Make sure toggle function works for radio button

Help and Support
- Make sure toggle function works for radio button

Out of Office
screenshot: Mobile/02_Setting3.jpg
- Settings button take user back to Settings page
- On top row, user needs to be able to turn on/off the radio button
- Duration need make the radio button works to toggle
- Subject, user can type and change existing Subject value
- Body, user can type and change existing Body value
- External Address, need able to toggle the radio button (screenshot: Mobile/02_Setting4.jpg)

DESKTOP VERSION

Blue Header Bar
- IBM TEST - Logo can be dead links (This is standard IBM bar/area)
- Set active menu for “Mail” with white colored border and other menus can be dead links
- Notice there’s arrow graphic for People, Communities and Apps (see spacing on 03-Desktop Fixes and existing prototype)
- On the right side all buttons can be dead links, but please show the arrow

Actions Column
- This column can use fixed width
- This column contains Compose button on the top
- Click Compose button need show New Message that will floating in the bottom. More details explained below
- Then existing Message tabs for Inbox, Need actions and Waiting For.
- Change to different tab need display different content for Active “message group” title, message list and Message Detail Column need show empty message.
- This is Message List page look for Need Actions tab (screenshot: Desktop/D01_Landing Page_Need Action.jpg)
- This is Message List page look for Waiting For tab (screenshot: Desktop/D01_Landing Page_Waiting List.jpg)
- Red number indicator need remains when user navigates to the other tabs
- Folders section, click show more will reveal current Folders menus (See Sidebar menu on Mobile)
- Contacts For the Important user list, user needs to be able to remove and add user
- Contacts: See the updated cards/actions: screenshot: 03-Desktop-Fixes/D02_Contact-Profile-Update.jpg
- All contacts just displayed thumbnails in 3 columns layout
- Click the thumbnail need display some actions buttons. Update existing icons look with rounded shape
- Re-click the thumbnail or click outside the thumbnail need hide the card
- All icons can be dead link
- User can scroll the page

Search Bar: See D01_Landing-Page-Update.jpg
- Search Bar placed with Message List Column width
- Active “message group” tab and number of message placed on the left side
- The messages will be an infinite scroll

Message List Column
- This column need use fluid width
- User need able to scroll the page, use browser based style
- Later in development, this area will use infinite scrolling.
- For desktop, we need disable press function and update into clickable checkboxes
- On top of Message list there’s yesterday title and list icon.
- List icon can be a dead link.
- And toggle buttons on the right side for attachment, link and filter by

Message Detail Column: D01_Landing-Page-Update.jpg
- This column need use fluid width
- Column height need expanded until blue header bar
- Header can use fixed placement and remain fixed when user scrolling the page
- This is default look before user selects any message with bee graphic placed on center of this column area
- Use browser based style

Date Navigator
- Date navigator placed in the bottom of screen and use fluid width
- There's arrow button on the left side to collapse/expand the area
- 3 icons on the right can be dead links
- Date navigator actions buttons and date information placed on the left side
- User need able to navigate the date
- Date timeline need use fluid width
- Time range are from 12am to 11pm. You need create 1 step increment
- User need able to scroll the timeline
- There's border indicated message. Use dummy placement for now

TABLET VERSION
screenshot: Tablet/T01_Landing Page.jpg

- On message list row, need display checkboxes on the left side

- This is Message List page look for Waiting For tab (screenshot: Tablet/T01_Landing Page_Waiting List.jpg)

MOBILE VERSION

- Notice after select message, action buttons bar show up in the bottom

02. Message Detail

DESKTOP VERSION
Message with Single Thread
Updated Design: 03-Desktop-FixesD02_Message Detail-Update.jpg
- This is what a Message looks with a single thread. User landed on this screen after click message with no “number indicator”
- Click each message need show blue background for selected message and the message detail show up in the right side
- Reply and Forward button placed on the left side
- Then, another action buttons on the right side
- Also, there’s arrow pointing up right is to let user open the message in separate window
- Separated window can contains of Message Detail column area only. Use your best judgement. Let us know if need clarification.
- Selecting message no need selected the checkbox. User can toggle only by click the checkbox

Message with Multiple Thread
screenshot: Desktop/D02_Message Detail_Multiple.jpg
- This is what a Message looks with multiple threads. User landed on this screen after click message with “number indicator”
- On message content area, header bar needs to display “Thread Action” before the action buttons
- On Expanded message, reply and forward button placed on the left side

Selecting Message
screenshot: Desktop/D02_Message Detail_Selecting.jpg

- When selected messages show up, display different action buttons
- There’s information about number of selected message
- User needs able to deselect by press deselect them all
- If 2nd column checkbox deselect, right 3rd column corresponding row need remove and if 3rd item is removed via pressing "x" button, 2nd column corresponding item should deselect
- Blue background for selected row need covered whole row
- Action buttons placed on the right side
- User can also deselect by press “x” button on the right side of selected message
- Use existing reply and forward icons like mobile
- Keep same

Selecting Message

screenshot: Tablet/T06_See Profile.jpg
- For tablet version, click thumbnail need show overlay panel

Client Priorities (The items that are considered highest prototype priorities)
- Code Documentation!
- Creating quality and efficient HTML/CSS3 code that works in all the requested browsers.
- All elements should be consistent, pay attention to padding, margin, line-height, etc.
- Matching the storyboards (as close as possible) across the required browsers.

CODE REQUIREMENTS:
HTML/HTML5
- Provide comments on the page elements to give a clear explanation of the code usage. The goal is to help future developers understand the code.
- Please use clean INDENTATION for all HTML code so future developers can follow the code.
- All HTML code naming should not have any conflicts or errors.
Element and Attribute names should be in lowercase and use a "-" or camel naming to separate multiple-word classes (i.e.. "main-content", or "mainContent)
- Use semantically correct tags- use H tags for headers, etc. Use strong and em tags instead of bold and italic tags.
- No inline CSS styles- all styles must be placed in an external stylesheet.
- Validate your code- reviewers may accept minor validation errors, but please comment your reason for any validation errors. Use the validators listed in the scorecard.

CSS3
- Use CSS3 Media Queries to load different styles for each page and don't build different page for different device/layout.
- Provide comments on the CSS code. We need CSS comments to give a clear explanation of the code usage. The goal is to help future developers understand the code.
- Please use clean INDENTATION for all CSS so developers can follow the code.
- All CSS naming should not have any conflicts.
- As possible use CSS3 style when create all styling.
- Use CSS to space out objects, not clear/transparent images (GIFs or PNGs) and use proper structural CSS to lay out your page. Only use table tags for tables of data/information and not for page layout.

Javascript
- All JavaScript must not have a copyright by a third party.
- You are encouraged to use your own scripts, or scripts that are free, publicly available and do not have copyright statements or author recognition requirements anywhere in the code.

Images
- Images should be properly compressed while still having good visual quality.
- Please use best practice repetition usage of background based image.
- Please use sprites when using icons for your submission.
- Make sure your submission look sharp for Retina and Standard devices

Browsers Requirements
- Chrome Latest Browser
- Safari Latest Browser
- Firefox Latest Browser
- Chrome, Firefox and Safari  on iPhone 4, 4s, 5, 5s, 6 and 6+ (Landscape & Portrait View)
- Chrome, Firefox and Safari  on iPad (Landscape & Portrait View)
- Android Browser
